Package com.rapidminer.belt.execution

Class ExecutionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.execution.ExecutionUtils
  • public final class ExecutionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility functions for executing Callables in a Context.
    Author:
    Gisa Meier

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public static <T> T run​(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> callable,
                        Context context)
        Runs the given callable in the given context and handles the exceptions under the assumption, that no checked exceptions come from the callable.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type
        Parameters:
        callable - a callable that throws no checked exception, e.g. one constructed via a lambda expression
        context - the context to use
        Returns:
        the result of the callable
        Throws:
        ExecutionAbortedException - if the callable throws a checked exception

      • run

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> run​(java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Callable<T>> callables,
                                        Context context)
        Runs the given callables in the given context and handles the exceptions under the assumption, that no checked exceptions come from the callables.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type
        Parameters:
        callables - a list of callables that throw no checked exceptions, e.g. constructed via lambda expressions
        context - the context to use
        Returns:
        the list of results of the callables
        Throws:
        ExecutionAbortedException - if one of the callable throws a checked exception

      • parallel

        public static void parallel​(int start,
                            int end,
                            java.util.function.IntConsumer task,
                            Context context)
        Can be used to execute multiple tasks in parallel. The consumer will be fed with the indices in the range [start, end). Executing a method doWork on every column of a given table can be done, e.g., via 
        ExecutionUtils.parallel(0, table.width(), i -> doWork(table.column(i)), context);
        Parameters:
        start - start of the index range
        end - end of the index range (exclusively)
        task - an IntConsumer that consumes an index and executes some task
        context - the Context used for the parallel execution
        Throws:
        ExecutionAbortedException - if the context goes inactive before the tasks are done
